intro: Cleidion cafcaf, commonly known as the coffee tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, red fruits that contain a single seed, which is used to cultivate coffee beans. Cleidion cafcaf thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
